segment.source: Modify the AGPM Service
segment.target: Modify the AGPM Service

segment.source: Modify the AGPM Service
segment.target: Modify the AGPM Service

segment.source: Modify the AGPM Service
segment.target: Modify the AGPM Service

segment.source: The AGPM Service is a Windows service that acts as a security proxy, managing client access to Group Policy Objects (GPOs) in the archive and production environment.
segment.target: The AGPM Service is a Windows service that acts as a security proxy, managing client access to Group Policy Objects (GPOs) in the archive and production environment.

segment.source: If this service is stopped or disabled, AGPM Clients cannot perform operations through the server.
segment.target: If this service is stopped or disabled, AGPM Clients cannot perform operations through the server.

segment.source: You can modify the archive path, the AGPM Service Account, and the port on which the AGPM Service listens.
segment.target: You can modify the archive path, the AGPM Service Account, and the port on which the AGPM Service listens.

segment.source: Caution
segment.target: Caution

segment.source: Do not modify settings for the AGPM Service through Administrative Tools and Services in the operating system.
segment.target: Do not modify settings for the AGPM Service through Administrative Tools and Services in the operating system.

segment.source: Doing so can prevent the AGPM Service from starting.
segment.target: Doing so can prevent the AGPM Service from starting.

segment.source: A user account that is a member of the Domain Admins group and has access to the AGPM Server (the computer on which Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management - Server is installed) is required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: A user account that is a member of the Domain Admins group and has access to the AGPM Server (the computer on which Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management - Server is installed) is required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: Additionally, you must provide credentials for the AGPM Service Account to complete this procedure.
segment.target: Additionally, you must provide credentials for the AGPM Service Account to complete this procedure.

segment.source: To modify the AGPM Service
segment.target: To modify the AGPM Service

segment.source: On the computer on which Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management - Server is installed:
segment.target: On the computer on which Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management - Server is installed:

segment.source: For Windows Server 2008, click Start, Control Panel, and Programs and Features.
segment.target: For Windows Server 2008, click Start, Control Panel, and Programs and Features.

segment.source: For Windows Vista, click Start, Control Panel, Programs, and Programs and Features.
segment.target: For Windows Vista, click Start, Control Panel, Programs, and Programs and Features.

segment.source: Right-click Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management - Server, and then click Change.
segment.target: Right-click Microsoft Advanced Group Policy Management - Server, and then click Change.

segment.source: Click Next, and then click Modify.
segment.target: Click Next, and then click Modify.

segment.source: Follow the instructions to configure the AGPM Service:
segment.target: Follow the instructions to configure the AGPM Service:

segment.source: In the Archive Path dialog box, enter a new location for the archive relative to the AGPM Server, or confirm the current archive path, and then click Next.
segment.target: In the Archive Path dialog box, enter a new location for the archive relative to the AGPM Server, or confirm the current archive path, and then click Next.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The archive path can point to a folder on the AGPM Server or elsewhere, but the location should have sufficient space to store all GPOs and history data managed by this AGPM Server.
segment.target: The archive path can point to a folder on the AGPM Server or elsewhere, but the location should have sufficient space to store all GPOs and history data managed by this AGPM Server.

segment.source: In the AGPM Service Account dialog box, enter credentials for a service account under which the AGPM Service will run, and click Next.
segment.target: In the AGPM Service Account dialog box, enter credentials for a service account under which the AGPM Service will run, and click Next.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Modifying the installation clears the credentials for the AGPM Service Account.
segment.target: Modifying the installation clears the credentials for the AGPM Service Account.

segment.source: You must re-enter credentials, but they are not required to match the credentials used during the original installation.
segment.target: You must re-enter credentials, but they are not required to match the credentials used during the original installation.

segment.source: The AGPM Service Account must have full access to the GPOs that it will manage and will be granted Log On As A Service permission.
segment.target: The AGPM Service Account must have full access to the GPOs that it will manage and will be granted Log On As A Service permission.

segment.source: If you will be managing GPOs on a single domain, you can make the Local System account for the primary domain controller the AGPM Service Account.
segment.target: If you will be managing GPOs on a single domain, you can make the Local System account for the primary domain controller the AGPM Service Account.

segment.source: If you will be managing GPOs on multiple domains or if a member server will be the AGPM Server, you should configure a different account as the AGPM Service Account because the Local System account for one domain controller cannot access GPOs on other domains.
segment.target: If you will be managing GPOs on multiple domains or if a member server will be the AGPM Server, you should configure a different account as the AGPM Service Account because the Local System account for one domain controller cannot access GPOs on other domains.

segment.source: In the Archive Owner dialog box, enter the user name of an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) or group of AGPM Administrators, and click Next.
segment.target: In the Archive Owner dialog box, enter the user name of an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) or group of AGPM Administrators, and click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Modifying the installation clears the credentials for the Archive Owner.
segment.target: Modifying the installation clears the credentials for the Archive Owner.

segment.source: You must re-enter credentials, but they are not required to match the credentials used during the original installation.
segment.target: You must re-enter credentials, but they are not required to match the credentials used during the original installation.

segment.source: In the Port Configuration dialog box, type a new port on which the AGPM Service should listen or confirm the port currently selected, and click Next.
segment.target: In the Port Configuration dialog box, type a new port on which the AGPM Service should listen or confirm the port currently selected, and click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: By default, the AGPM Service listens on port 4600.
segment.target: By default, the AGPM Service listens on port 4600.

segment.source: If you manually configure port exceptions or have rules configuring port exceptions, you can clear the Add port exception to firewall check box.
segment.target: If you manually configure port exceptions or have rules configuring port exceptions, you can clear the Add port exception to firewall check box.

segment.source: Click Change, and when the installation is complete click Finish.
segment.target: Click Change, and when the installation is complete click Finish.

segment.source: If you have changed the port on which the AGPM Service listens, modify the port in the AGPM Server connection for each Group Policy administrator.
segment.target: If you have changed the port on which the AGPM Service listens, modify the port in the AGPM Server connection for each Group Policy administrator.

segment.source: (For more information, see Configure AGPM Server Connections.)
segment.target: (For more information, see Configure AGPM Server Connections.)

segment.source: Repeat for each AGPM Server to which the configuration changes should be applied.
segment.target: Repeat for each AGPM Server to which the configuration changes should be applied.

segment.source: Additional references
segment.target: Additional references

segment.source: Managing the AGPM Service
segment.target: Managing the AGPM Service
